column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Employee training and development are integral to Sonic's commitment to medical excellence. Sonic Healthcare also nurtures staff through internal development programs designed to identify, teach and develop current and future leaders.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column8: Procedural training of medical, scientific, and technical staff
column13: Sonic provides ongoing training for staff across all divisions and disciplines. In addition to procedural training of medical, scientific and technical staff and pathology collectors, we offer specially tailored leadership development workshops.\t

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Mentoring programs are structured initiatives to facilitate a supportive and developmental relationship between experienced and less experienced individuals. These programs foster the mentee's personal and professional growth by providing guidance, knowledge, and support. Mentoring relationships typically involve transferring skills, expertise, and insights from the mentor to the mentee, contributing to the latter's career development, skill acquisition, and overall success.\t

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Sonic Healthcare UK has taken an innovative long-term approach to address the ongoing shortage of skilled scientists in Biomedical Science. Recognizing the role we all play in growing the next generations of scientists, the division has created the Sonic Training Academy. This degree apprenticeship program combines university study with a paid position working in a laboratory.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Work is also underway at the Royal Free Hospital in London to create a training laboratory to support the apprenticeship program. It will provide skills-based workshops, seminars and practical sessions for the apprentices and support broader organizational training initiatives.

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column7: Sonic Diversity Policy outlines the principles that ensure we have a broad range of experience, talent and viewpoints in our businesses across age, gender and ethnicity. Women comprise 73% of Sonic's workforce and 53% of senior leadership, defined as manager level and above, including our doctors.

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column7: Sonic aims to improve people's lives by providing access to safe, high-quality healthcare services ethically and with integrity. As a global healthcare organisation with diverse supply chains and operations, we take seriously our responsibility to defend the human rights that support each individual's entitlement to health, education and a decent standard of living, free from oppression and all forms of modern slavery.

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column7: This Modern Slavery Statement assumes the definition of Modern Slavery to include the trafficking of people, slavery, servitude, forced labour, debt bondage, deceptive recruiting for labour or service, and the worst forms of child labour.

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column7: Sonic's Code of Conduct and our Labour Standards & Human Rights Policy state that they do not accept any form of slavery and prohibit the use of all forms of forced labour, including bonded labour and slave labour.

Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Sonic has continued our ongoing involvement with The Clontarf Foundation. This Australian not-for-profit organization exists to improve the education, self-esteem and employment prospects of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander boys and young men. Through mentoring and participation in team sports, Clontarf provides its students with life skills to succeed and grow, which benefits the whole community and the individuals involved.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: HEAL Africa is a full-service tertiary hospital in Goma, in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It is one of only three referral hospitals in the war-torn country. It provides obstetrics and gynaecology (including fistula repair), general surgery, orthopaedics, paediatrics and internal medicine, and established pathology and radiology services.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Barbara May Foundation was established in 2009 to provide free healthcare services for women in sub-Saharan Africa, focused on safe childbirth and fistula repair. The Sonic Foundation will continue supporting this service through cash donations and laboratory and radiology service support at the Barbara May Foundation Hospitals in Tanzania and Ethiopia.
column20: Local Community, Barbara May Foundation, Support

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Radiology Across Borders (RAB) is an Australian-based_x0002_, not-for-profit organization that aims to provide long-term, tangible support in radiology/healthcare to developing nations worldwide. The Sonic Healthcare Foundation is one of Radiology Across Borders' sponsors, helping it support a range of pro bono projects covering education, consultancy, infrastructure, collegial support, and mentorship.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Sonic also supports many local charities and events and donated $8 million in cash, in-kind donations and sponsorships in FY2023. It included donations supporting charities and research into medical treatments for many types of cancer and other medical conditions.\t

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Sonic Healthcare Foundation is sponsoring the establishment of a new laboratory at the Jaramogi Oginga Odinga University of Science and Technology (JOOUST) in the Lake Victoria basin of western Kenya. The training and reference clinical, molecular and histopathology laboratories for infectious and non-infectious diseases will be used for teaching, research and third-line diagnostic patient support.

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: Supplier human rights questionnaires are tools Sonic Healthcare uses to assess and evaluate the human rights practices of its suppliers. These questionnaires are designed to gather information from suppliers about their policies, procedures, and performance related to human rights issues.

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Media monitoring refers to systematically tracking and analyzing media coverage and public sentiment and discussing issues that adversely affect society. Negative social impact can encompass a range of concerns, including but not limited to social injustice, discrimination, environmental degradation, public health crises, human rights violations, and unethical business practices.

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: The periodic validation of suppliers refers to organisations' systematic and regular process to assess and confirm their suppliers' continued compliance, reliability, and performance. This validation process involves reviewing and verifying various aspects of a supplier's operations, including quality standards, regulatory compliance, ethical practices, and overall adherence to the terms of the supplier agreement.

column6: Political contributions
column7: No financial or in-kind political donations were made in FY2023.

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column7: During FY2023, 2,704 external and 4,727 internal audits were conducted across Sonic sites. It represents an increase in total audits of 5% compared with FY2022. No significant adverse findings were recorded as a result of these audits.

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
column7: Sonic's operating facilities maintained accreditation and licenses during FY2023, with no significant adverse finding resulting from accreditation inspections by external regulatory authorities.

column13: All users accessing our IT systems participate in information_x0002_security awareness training and are only given access levels appropriate to their needs. Our well-resourced IT division maintains a specialist cybersecurity unit to detect and prevent cybersecurity breaches and service interruptions.
